data.title: Argonne User Facility Agreements
data.text:
If you are not an Argonne National Laboratory employee, a user agreement signed by your home institution is a prerequisite for work at any of Argonne's user facilities. Argonneâ€™s User Facilities include:

The Advanced Photon Source (APS)

The Center for Nanoscale Materials (CNM)

The Argonne Leadership Computing Facility (ALCF)

The Argonne Tandem Linac Accelerator System (ATLAS)

The Intermediate Voltage Electron Microscopy (IVEM) - Tandem Facility

Atmospheric Radiation Measurement (ARM)

Southern Great Plains (SGP)

Bankhead National Forest (BNF)

The Department of Energy recently formulated master agreements that cover liability, intellectual property, and financial issues (access templates from the links in the left sidebar). The names of institutions with master agreements currently in place appear below.

If your institution does not appear in the list below*, complete an online User Agreement Questionnaire, which is the first step toward putting a master user agreement in place.

* If there is a limited agreement covering participants from your institution for research at the specific facility you plan to use, it will be valid during the transition to a master agreement.
